verses.verse: [A song, the psalme of the sonnes of Corach, to the chiefe musition vpon Mahalath Leannoth, a wise instruction of Heman the Ezrahite.] O God the Lorde of my saluation, I crye day and night before thee:
(88:1) let my prayer enter into thy presence, encline thyne eare vnto my crying.
(88:2) For my soule is full of miserie: and my life toucheth the graue.
(88:3) I am counted as one of them that go downe vnto the pit: and I am nowe become a man that hath no strength.
(88:4) I am free among the dead: like such as beyng kylled lye in a graue, whom thou remembrest no more, and are cut away from thy hande.
(88:5) Thou hast layde me in the lowest pit: in darknes and in deepenes.
(88:6) Thyne indignation sore presseth me: and thou hast vexed me with all thy stormes. Selah.
(88:7) Thou hast put away myne acquaintaunce farre from me, and made me to be abhorred of them: I am shut vp, I can not get foorth.
(88:8) My sight fayleth through my affliction O God: I haue called dayly vpon thee, I haue stretched out mine handes vnto thee.
(88:9) Wylt thou worke a miracle amongst the dead? or shal the dead rise vp againe [and] acknowledge thee? Selah.
(88:10) Shall thy louing kindnes be talked of in the graue? or thy faythfulnes in destruction?
(88:11) Shall thy wonderous workes be knowen in the darke? and thy righteousnes in the lande of forgetfulnes?
(88:12) But vnto thee do I crye O God: and my prayer commeth early in the morning before thee.
(88:13) O God, why abhorrest thou my soule: and [why] hidest thou thy face from me?
(88:14) I am in miserie, I labour euen from my youth with the panges of death: I haue suffered thy terrours, [and] I am styll in doubt.
(88:15) Thyne indignation hath gone ouer me: and thy terrours haue vndone me.
(88:16) They came rounde about me dayly lyke water: and compassed me altogether on euery syde.
(88:17) Thou hast put a way farre from me my frende and neighbour: [thou hast hid] mine acquaintaunce out of sight.
